body.name: Knee Deep: A Cam Derringer Novel (Tropical Adventure Series book 1)
body.description: A DEADLY MISSION. A SADISTIC CRIMINAL ORGANIZATION. A DANGEROUS HUNT FOR REVENGE.Cam Derringer's world is turned upside down with the tragic loss of his wife. Unable to cope, he embarks on a dangerous journey for revenge that leads him deep into the criminal underworld. When the FBI and a sadistic criminal organization start coming after him, will Cam be able to uncover the truth before becoming their next victim? Knee Deep is a thrilling crime fiction novel that takes readers on a heart-stopping ride through every twist and turn. Grab your copy today!For LARGE PRINT, please use the desktop site.This book was re-edited in July 2020.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great book
reviews.reviewText: Knee Deep is an exciting start to Mac's Tropical Adventure series. It's fast-paced with lots of action . A great read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Knee Deep in Trouble
reviews.reviewText: Cam Derringer, a private investigator out of Key West, is abducted and left beaten, naked, and unconscious on an isolated, dark road when he runs afoul of a gang of boat-jackers. He is found by the beautiful Jenny, who quickly insinuates herself into his life, both professionally and personally. Soon, his partner goes missing, reminding Cam of the unsolved case of his lost wife. Events move quickly as the author weaves a tale full of intrigue populated by the colorful and shady characters who inhabit the exotic locale. Untangling the truth from the lies takes all of Cam's skill as he gradually realizes the boat-jackers are deadly dangerous and plotting a much more insidious purpose. The story is told in a straight forward style, full of conversational asides and interesting characters. I enjoyed the avuncular relationship Cam had with his assistant, the lovely Diane. I developed an immediate affection for several of the characters, in particular the wayward bartender Dave, whose carefree lifestyle is complicated by his attraction to women of questionable sanity. Anyone who enjoys a fast paced contemporary mystery will enjoy "Knee Deep." The author Mac (Cam?) Fortner, a native Hoosier, indicates this is the first in a proposed series, so further adventures of the guitar-playing sleuth with a fondness for Wild Turkey and pretty women may be on the horizon. It is my hope that Cam Derringer takes his place in the private eye canon along side Remington Steele, Magnum PI, and John Shaft. "Knee Deep" is an entertaining, engrossing, and easy read. I could happily envision it as a successful television series. .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Plot twist and action
reviews.reviewText: This is the first Mac Fortner book I've read, and I'll be following his work.It is well written and kept me turning the pages to the end.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Never a dull moment in this story! It has all the action and great characters you look for in a story! Great read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2022
reviews.reviewText: A very good first book of a new character. A serious story but with some humor and mild romance. I liked the smooth flowing plot and the different twists the characters went through. I rated the book as a very good read. Take some time and enjoy this good book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Billie, Bill, Billy, Willie, William. All of these names were attached to DIFFERENT characters in this book. I am sure there are many more names available to use in a story. It was an interesting book in some ways. But I won't read anything else by this author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exciting and Intriguing.
reviews.reviewText: The story was fun to try and figure out who was who. I liked that the characters were defined and was able to like and dislike.I look forward to reading more from this author. I would recommend this book for a good read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Knee Deep - a review by Rosemary Kenny
reviews.reviewText: Key West PI Cam Derringer has been looking for evidence in the rapidly-cooling case of his wife Malinda, missing (after a suspected boat-jacking raid five years earlier). As his search continues he's involved in a violent event that nearly proves fatal. Who's Jenny Jacobs? Why does she help him?Hired by a wife to find her missing husband, Cam and his 'daughter' Diane are getting too close to the truth for both sides of a terrorist plot, that's linked to boat-jacking and drug-running.As the body-count in Davy Jones' locker rises, Cam faces tough questions from the FBI...he's knee deep in trouble and a net of death and betrayal is gradually closing in on him.Mac Fortner really knows his stuff when it comes to riveting crime-thrillers and flawed, believable main characters, in exciting storylines.Get your copy of Knee Deep as soon as you can - it's a sure-fire, action-thriller-winner of an adventure to grace your bookshelves... don't miss it!
Did not see the ending coming ... and that was great ... I liked that there were all kinds of twists.
Average read. Not to my liking

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 28, 2022
reviews.reviewText: A fast action packed read leading you round in circles, with its twists and turns gradually unravelling as the story progresses. Good story line and good characters well worth the read and highly recommended by me

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 28, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Narrator Tom Taverna becomes the Key West P.I. fan Derringer, as he gets drawn into the search for a missing man, an insurance assessor, gone for three weeks. Dan's own wife vanished five years before and he's still trying to find out what happened to her. Then along comes this rather attractive woman who almost makes him forget his post love. But then more people in the little port start vanishing including his Cam's partner.Written in the first person so that everything becomes immediate and personal, the text doesn't pull it's punches right up to the father predictable ending. But with interesting characters and full action plot, this story is recommended to those who enjoy the slow of waves on a boat as well as slaps on the protagonists.Fast, furious and funny
Enjoyed the book and the pace, wondered how the deaths were fixed once figured out the players. Great leading character.
